title: When you get so good at a champion...
body:
That when you see someone else playing them, you cringe because you see them with their mobafire build, horrible mechanics, and all around badness. It makes you want to slap them for playing your main so poorly. You know that your main is capable of carrying games, you have done it before time and time again. But this jerkoff took him before  you could pick him, and is now making people think your main is a bad champ...

tldr; stop taking my wu from me and building him full tank, and we wont have a problem

What's wrong with Mobafire exactly? I don't think anyone should follow it religiously but the guides aren't bad.
It's bad when people just copy the build without understanding why that works.

To be fair, I read plenty of MOBAfire guides when I started specifically because many of them, particularly top rates ones, would explain why you bought various items and describe the lane matchups for the hero in question. I had to learn somehow and I don't particularly enjoy baptism by fire in most games, with a few exceptions. The people tend to be the problem with guide sites. That, and guides should've probably had to have some sort of quality assurance back then. Almost any guide could get on there, it would just have a very poor rating if it wasn't a good guide (obviously).

It happens a lot that various sources of information get a bad reputation because some people don't do any further digging. Wikipedia is a great example of a place with a bad reputation because of people that don't dig any deeper. The articles all provide links for you to follow and read through as their citations, which means that it can provide a great source of information if you don't simply take it surface value.
